<s>[INST] You are a helpful agent that derives knowledge graph from the english text provided by the user. Entities you'll be coming up with while generating knowledge graph from user-provided text are: The Awful Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles, Cats, Munkustrap, Pekes, Pollicles, Great Rumpus Cat. Relationships you'll be coming up with while generating knowledge graph from user-provided text are: is a song in, is sung mostly by, describes a battle between, bark, stage the battles by dressing up as, barking in each other's faces, goes on until, arrives and scares the dogs away. Objects you'll be coming up with while generating knowledge graph from user-provided text are: The Awful Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles, musical, two neighbouring dog tribes, until you could hear them all over the park. Text given to you is "The Awful Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles" is a song in the musical Cats. It is sung mostly by Munkustrap. It describes a battle between two neighbouring dog tribes, the Pekes and the Pollicles, who bark "until you could hear them all over the park". The cats stage the battles by dressing up as dogs and barking in each other's faces. This goes on until the Great Rumpus Cat arrives and scares the dogs away. [/INST], <http://dbpedia.org/resource/The_Awful_Battle_of_the_Pekes_and_the_Pollicles> <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#comment> "The Awful Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles" is a song in the musical Cats. It is sung mostly by Munkustrap. It describes a battle between two neighbouring dog tribes, the Pekes and the Pollicles, who bark "until you could hear them all over the park". The cats stage the battles by dressing up as dogs and barking in each other's faces. This goes on until the Great Rumpus Cat arrives and scares the dogs away.". </s>

Text given to you is John Simon Bercow (born January 19 1963) is a politician and Conservative Party Member of Parliament for Buckingham in the United Kingdom with a current majority of 18,129 votes. He has a long-standing interest in Burma and has frequently raised issues of democracy and genocide in the country. In 2006 he was made a Patron of the Tory Reform Group. [/INST], <http://dbpedia.org/resource/John_Bercow> <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#comment> 'John Simon Bercow (born January 19 1963) is a politician and Conservative Party Member of Parliament for Buckingham in the United Kingdom with a current majority of 18,129 votes. He has a long-standing interest in Burma and has frequently raised issues of democracy and genocide in the country. In 2006 he was made a Patron of the Tory Reform Group.'. </s>

<s>[INST] You are a helpful agent that derives knowledge graph from the english text provided by the user. Entities you'll be coming up with while generating knowledge graph from user-provided text are: Jean-Luc Godard, Woody Allen, films, movies, life, relationships, directors, actors, segments, title cards, black cards, white type. Relationships you'll be coming up with while generating knowledge graph from user-provided text are: interviews, featuring, talk about, separated by. Objects you'll be coming up with while generating knowledge graph from user-provided text are: Meetin' WA, 1986, short film, old friend, photographs, film clips, past, 26 minutes. Text given to you is Meetin' WA is a 1986 short film by Jean-Luc Godard. In the film, he interviews his "old friend" Woody Allen. Throughout the film there are cuts in the interviews featuring photographs and film clips from Woody Allen's films. The two of them talk about movies, life, relationships to other directors and actors and Woody's past. The segments of the interview are separated by title cards, black cards and white type, a Woody Allen trademark. It runs for 26 minutes. [/INST], <http://dbpedia.org/resource/Meetin%27_WA> <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#comment> "Meetin' WA is a 1986 short film by Jean-Luc Godard. In the film, he interviews his \"old friend\" Woody Allen. Throughout the film there are cuts in the interviews featuring photographs and film clips from Woody Allen's films. The two of them talk about movies, life, relationships to other directors and actors and Woody's past. The segments of the interview are separated by title cards, black cards and white type, a Woody Allen trademark. It runs for 26 minutes.". </s>

In 2006 it had a population of 746.". </s>

Objects you'll be coming up with while generating knowledge graph from user-provided text are: Human Frailty, 1986. Text given to you is Human Frailty is an album released by Australian band Hunters & Collectors in 1986. It was their commercial breakthrough album in Australia, and a commercial and critical success. Singles from the album were 'Say Goodbye', 'Throw Your Arms Around Me' (a re-recorded version of the previous release as a single) and 'Everything's On Fire'. [/INST], <http://dbpedia.org/resource/Human_Frailty> <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#comment> 'Human Frailty is an album released by Australian band Hunters & Collectors in 1986. It was their commercial breakthrough album in Australia, and a commercial and critical success. Singles from the album were 'Say Goodbye', 'Throw Your Arms Around Me' (a re-recorded version of the previous release as a single) and 'Everything's On Fire'.'. </s>
